channel.title: ActionTimer doesn't work?

item.title: ActionTimer doesn't work?
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:2, topic:278070”] case 4168: //chest if(actionTimer == 0) { if (playerLevel[17] >= 75) { actionTimer = 10; addSkillXP((10000 * playerLevel[17]), 17); addItem(995, 500000); sendMessage("You steal 500k from the chest."); } else { sendMessage("You need a thieving level of 75 to steal from this chest."); } } break; [/quote]

Thank you

Read full topic

item.title: ActionTimer doesn't work?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

case 4168: //chest
    if(actionTimer == 0) {
        if (playerLevel[17] >= 75) {
	    actionTimer = 10;
	    addSkillXP((10000 * playerLevel[17]), 17);
	    addItem(995, 500000);
	    sendMessage("You steal 500k from the chest.");
	} else {
	    sendMessage("You need a thieving level of 75 to steal from this chest.");
	}
    }
    break;

item.title: ActionTimer doesn't work?
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

this is my code:

case 4168: //chest
	if (playerLevel[17] >= 75) {
	actionTimer = 10;
	addSkillXP((10000 * playerLevel[17]), 17);
	addItem(995, 500000);
	sendMessage("You steal 500k from the chest.");
	} else {
	sendMessage("You need a thieving level of 75 to steal from this chest.");
	}
        break;

Whenever I thieve the chest and click it 5 times really fast, it works for all of them. I want the delay to be like, 5 seconds.
I tried putting the timer in different spots but that didn’t seem to work either.

Read full topic
